name: Data Description and Preparation
content:
Data Description and Preparation


The project relies on video data as the primary input. Below is a breakdown of the data types involved and their characteristics:

a. Input Data

  • Video Files:
  • Formats: MP4, AVI, MKV, MOV, and other common formats.
  • Resolution: Support for varying resolutions, from low quality (360p) to high definition (1080p and above).
  • Duration: Videos ranging from a few minutes to several hours.
  • Audio Data (extracted from videos):
  • Format: WAV, MP3, or other standard audio formats.
  • Purpose: Used for generating transcripts via automatic speech recognition (ASR).

b. Derived Data

  • Text Transcripts:
  • Extracted using ASR tools from the videoâs audio.
  • Format: Plain text or structured JSON for downstream processing.
  • Quality: May contain errors depending on the clarity of the audio and the accuracy of the ASR system.
  • Frames:
  • Extracted as images from videos at specific intervals.
  • Used for visual analysis or contextual enhancement (if necessary).
